sentences.sContent: People who litter often have no pride in the area.
sentences.sCn: 经常随地乱扔垃圾的人没有地区荣誉感。

sentences.sContent: People who drop litter can be fined in some cities.
sentences.sCn: 在有些城市，乱扔垃圾的人会被罚款。

synos.tran: 垃圾；轿，担架；一窝（动物的幼崽）；凌乱

words.tran: 在街道或公共场所乱丢垃圾的人

remMethod.val: 把little的“l”乱丢， 错拿成“r” → 乱扔东西

trans.tranCn: 使凌乱；把...弄乱；乱扔（垃圾）
trans.tranOther: if things litter an area, there are a lot of them in that place, scattered in an untidy way
waste paper, cans etc that people have thrown away and left on the ground in a public place
